definition: essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal

sentences.english: In the auto parts exhibition of all the exhibitors have been carefully selected.
sentences.chinese: 在汽车配件展厅中所有展示商都经过精挑细选。

sentences.english: They are printed by a select group of lithographers.
sentences.chinese: 他们是由一组精挑细选出来的印刷商印制的。

sentences.english: These well-chosen words sum up the heart of agile development.
sentences.chinese: 这些精挑细选的词汇道出了敏捷开发的核心。

sentences.english: The plastic would be culled and turned into pellets for plastic production.
sentences.chinese: 塑料将会在被精挑细选之后制成小球来生产塑料产品。

sentences.english: The givers chose presents with care and imagination, and hoped the recipients would treasure them.
sentences.chinese: 送礼者发挥想象力，精挑细选，希望受礼者珍爱。

sentences.english: And all second-hand housing transactions have been carefully selected companies.
sentences.chinese: 而且所有二手房交易商都经过精挑细选。

sentences.english: The grapes are sourced from the choicest vineyards.
sentences.chinese: 酿造疯马的葡萄都来自最精挑细选的葡萄园。

sentences.english: With head slightly tilted he would mince his carefully selected words in a deep voice.
sentences.chinese: 他头微偏着，用深沉的嗓音吞吐出精挑细选的语词。

sentences.english: But at any rate, it's a rather select club.
sentences.chinese: 但无论如何，这是一个相当精挑细选出来的集团。

sentences.english: The first is to charge not for music but for selections of music.
sentences.chinese: 第一条路是音乐免费，但是精挑细选要收费。

sentences.english: In infants supplementary food hall for all show information is carefully vetted.
sentences.chinese: 在婴儿辅食展厅中所有展示信息都经过精挑细选。

sentences.english: Xiao-Yi Pavilion in the stock of all the exhibitors have been carefully selected.
sentences.chinese: 在股票效易商展厅中所有展示商都经过精挑细选。

definition: to guard a pass/to check on sth
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
genuine goods at fair prices/(fig.) genuine/real/true
to win an election/to get a position by passing the imperial exam
carefully chosen/handpicked/best of the bunch/choice (product)/concentration (mining)/to concentrate/to winnow
monotone/only one ingredient/(mahjong) all in the same suit
